content:
IndexingParametersExtensions Class

Definition

Defines extension methods for the IndexingParameters class.

In this Article

public static class IndexingParametersExtensions
Inheritance
Object
IndexingParametersExtensions

Methods

DoNotFailOnUnsupportedContentType(IndexingParameters)

Specifies that BlobExtractionMode.StorageMetadata blob extraction mode will be automatically used for blobs of unsupported content types. The default is false.
ExcludeFileNameExtensions(IndexingParameters, String[])

Specifies that the indexer will not index blobs with the file name extensions you specify. Each string is a file extensions with a leading dot. For example, ".pdf", ".docx", etc. If you pass the same file extension to this method and IndexFileNameExtensions, blobs with that extension will be excluded from indexing (that is, this method takes precedence). See for details.
IndexFileNameExtensions(IndexingParameters, String[])

Specifies that the indexer will index only the blobs with the file name extensions you specify. Each string is a file extensions with a leading dot. For example, ".pdf", ".docx", etc. If you pass the same file extension to this method and ExcludeFileNameExtensions, blobs with that extension will be excluded from indexing (that is, ExcludeFileNameExtensions takes precedence). See for details.
IndexStorageMetadataOnly(IndexingParameters)

Specifies that the indexer will index only the storage metadata and completely skip the document extraction process. This is useful when you don't need the document content, nor do you need any of the content type-specific metadata properties. See for details.
SetBlobExtractionMode(IndexingParameters, BlobExtractionMode)

Specifies which parts of a blob will be indexed by the blob storage indexer.
SkipContent(IndexingParameters)

Specifies that the indexer will extract metadata, but skip content extraction for all blobs. If you want to skip content extraction for only some blobs, add AzureSearch_SkipContent metadata to those blobs individually instead of using this option. See for details.
